005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
011import edu.wpi.first.networktables.MultiSubscriber;
012import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTable;
013import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableEntry;
014import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableEvent;
015import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
016import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableListener;
017import edu.wpi.first.networktables.StringPublisher;
018import edu.wpi.first.networktables.Topic;
019import java.util.Collection;
020
021/**
022 * The preferences class provides a relatively simple way to save important values to the roboRIO to
023 * access the next time the roboRIO is booted.
024 *
025 * <p>This class loads and saves from a file inside the roboRIO. The user can not access the file
026 * directly, but may modify values at specific fields which will then be automatically saved to the
027 * file by the NetworkTables server.
028 *
029 * <p>This class is thread safe.
030 *
031 * <p>This will also interact with {@link NetworkTable} by creating a table called "Preferences"
032 * with all the key-value pairs.
033 */
034public final class Preferences {
035  /** The Preferences table name. */
036  private static final String TABLE_NAME = "Preferences";
037  /** The network table. */
038  private static NetworkTable m_table;
039
040  private static StringPublisher m_typePublisher;
041  private static MultiSubscriber m_tableSubscriber;
042  private static NetworkTableListener m_listener;
043
044  /** Creates a preference class. */
045  private Preferences() {}
046
047  static {
048    setNetworkTableInstance(NetworkTableInstance.getDefault());
049    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_Preferences, 0);
050  }
051
052  /**
053   * Set the NetworkTable instance used for entries. For testing purposes; use with caution.
054   *
055   * @param inst NetworkTable instance
056   */
057  public static synchronized void setNetworkTableInstance(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
058    m_table = inst.getTable(TABLE_NAME);
059    if (m_typePublisher != null) {
060      m_typePublisher.close();
061    }
062    m_typePublisher = m_table.getStringTopic(".type").publish();
063    m_typePublisher.set("RobotPreferences");
064
065    // Subscribe to all Preferences; this ensures we get the latest values
066    // ahead of a getter call.
067    if (m_tableSubscriber != null) {
068      m_tableSubscriber.close();
069    }
070    m_tableSubscriber = new MultiSubscriber(inst, new String[] {m_table.getPath() + "/"});
071
072    // Listener to set all Preferences values to persistent
073    // (for backwards compatibility with old dashboards).
074    if (m_listener != null) {
075      m_listener.close();
076    }
077    m_listener =
078        NetworkTableListener.createListener(
079            m_tableSubscriber,
080            NetworkTableEvent.kImmediate | NetworkTableEvent.kPublish,
081            event -> {
082              if (event.topicInfo != null) {
083                Topic topic = event.topicInfo.getTopic();
084                if (!topic.equals(m_typePublisher.getTopic())) {
085                  event.topicInfo.getTopic().setPersistent(true);
086                }
087              }
088            });
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Gets the preferences keys.
093   *
094   * @return a collection of the keys
095   */
096  public static Collection<String> getKeys() {
097    return m_table.getKeys();
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Puts the given string into the preferences table.
102   *
103   * @param key the key
104   * @param value the value
105   * @throws NullPointerException if value is null
106   */
107  public static void setString(String key, String value) {
108    requireNonNullParam(value, "value", "setString");
109
110    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
111    entry.setString(value);
112    entry.setPersistent();
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Puts the given string into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
117   *
118   * @param key The key
119   * @param value The value
120   */
121  public static void initString(String key, String value) {
122    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
123    entry.setDefaultString(value);
124    entry.setPersistent();
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Puts the given int into the preferences table.
129   *
130   * @param key the key
131   * @param value the value
132   */
133  public static void setInt(String key, int value) {
134    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
135    entry.setDouble(value);
136    entry.setPersistent();
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Puts the given int into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
141   *
142   * @param key The key
143   * @param value The value
144   */
145  public static void initInt(String key, int value) {
146    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
147    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
148    entry.setPersistent();
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Puts the given double into the preferences table.
153   *
154   * @param key the key
155   * @param value the value
156   */
157  public static void setDouble(String key, double value) {
158    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
159    entry.setDouble(value);
160    entry.setPersistent();
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Puts the given double into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
165   *
166   * @param key The key
167   * @param value The value
168   */
169  public static void initDouble(String key, double value) {
170    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
171    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
172    entry.setPersistent();
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Puts the given float into the preferences table.
177   *
178   * @param key the key
179   * @param value the value
180   */
181  public static void setFloat(String key, float value) {
182    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
183    entry.setDouble(value);
184    entry.setPersistent();
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Puts the given float into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
189   *
190   * @param key The key
191   * @param value The value
192   */
193  public static void initFloat(String key, float value) {
194    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
195    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
196    entry.setPersistent();
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Puts the given boolean into the preferences table.
201   *
202   * @param key the key
203   * @param value the value
204   */
205  public static void setBoolean(String key, boolean value) {
206    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
207    entry.setBoolean(value);
208    entry.setPersistent();
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Puts the given boolean into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
213   *
214   * @param key The key
215   * @param value The value
216   */
217  public static void initBoolean(String key, boolean value) {
218    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
219    entry.setDefaultBoolean(value);
220    entry.setPersistent();
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Puts the given long into the preferences table.
225   *
226   * @param key the key
227   * @param value the value
228   */
229  public static void setLong(String key, long value) {
230    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
231    entry.setDouble(value);
232    entry.setPersistent();
233  }
234
235  /**
236   * Puts the given long into the preferences table if it doesn't already exist.
237   *
238   * @param key The key
239   * @param value The value
240   */
241  public static void initLong(String key, long value) {
242    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
243    entry.setDefaultDouble(value);
244    entry.setPersistent();
245  }
246
247  /**
248   * Returns whether or not there is a key with the given name.
249   *
250   * @param key the key
251   * @return if there is a value at the given key
252   */
253  public static boolean containsKey(String key) {
254    return m_table.containsKey(key);
255  }
256
257  /**
258   * Remove a preference.
259   *
260   * @param key the key
261   */
262  public static void remove(String key) {
263    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_table.getEntry(key);
264    entry.clearPersistent();
265    entry.unpublish();
266  }
267
268  /** Remove all preferences. */
269  public static void removeAll() {
270    for (String key : m_table.getKeys()) {
271      if (!".type".equals(key)) {
272        remove(key);
273      }
274    }
275  }
276
277  /**
278   * Returns the string at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
279   * then the given backup value will be returned.
280   *
281   * @param key the key
282   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
283   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
284   */
285  public static String getString(String key, String backup) {
286    return m_table.getEntry(key).getString(backup);
287  }
288
289  /**
290   * Returns the int at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
291   * the given backup value will be returned.
292   *
293   * @param key the key
294   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
295   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
296   */
297  public static int getInt(String key, int backup) {
298    return (int) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
299  }
300
301  /**
302   * Returns the double at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
303   * then the given backup value will be returned.
304   *
305   * @param key the key
306   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
307   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
308   */
309  public static double getDouble(String key, double backup) {
310    return m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
311  }
312
313  /**
314   * Returns the boolean at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position,
315   * then the given backup value will be returned.
316   *
317   * @param key the key
318   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
319   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
320   */
321  public static boolean getBoolean(String key, boolean backup) {
322    return m_table.getEntry(key).getBoolean(backup);
323  }
324
325  /**
326   * Returns the float at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
327   * the given backup value will be returned.
328   *
329   * @param key the key
330   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
331   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
332   */
333  public static float getFloat(String key, float backup) {
334    return (float) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
335  }
336
337  /**
338   * Returns the long at the given key. If this table does not have a value for that position, then
339   * the given backup value will be returned.
340   *
341   * @param key the key
342   * @param backup the value to return if none exists in the table
343   * @return either the value in the table, or the backup
344   */
345  public static long getLong(String key, long backup) {
346    return (long) m_table.getEntry(key).getDouble(backup);
347  }
348}
